conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The image shows four liquid sources labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, multiple baffles in various orientations, and three containers labeled E, F, and G at the bottom.
Liquid A flows vertically downward from point A.
Liquid A encounters a horizontal baffle that redirects its flow horizontally towards the left.
Liquid A hits another baffle that guides it downwards.
Liquid A flows into container E.
Liquid B flows vertically downward from point B.
Liquid B hits a horizontal baffle that redirects it horizontally towards the right.
Liquid B encounters another baffle but continues flowing horizontally until it reaches the bottom.
Liquid B flows into container F.
Liquid C flows vertically downward from point C.
Liquid C encounters a horizontal baffle that redirects it horizontally towards the right.
Liquid C hits another baffle that guides it downwards.
Liquid C flows into container G.
Liquid D flows vertically downward from point D.
Liquid D encounters a horizontal baffle that redirects it horizontally towards the left.
Liquid D hits another baffle but continues flowing horizontally until it reaches the bottom.
Liquid D flows into container E.
Summary: Liquid A flows into container E, Liquid B flows into container F, Liquid C flows into container G, and Liquid D flows into container E.
Final Answer: Container E receives liquids from A and D, container F receives liquid from B, and container G receives liquid from C.
